quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Capital and Country
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, phnom, trenton. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Montevideo is the capital of this second smallest country in South America, after Suriname.
Caracas is the capital of this country, a Spanish colony for more than 300 years, before it declared its independence in the early 19th century.
None of these  could be found in Europe before the Great Geographical Discoveries:
With the aid of Queen Isabella of Spain, Christopher Columbus set off in 1492 using three tiny ships.  One of these ships was not part of the expedition.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Victoria

questions.question: Trenton is the capital of this eastern state.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: New Jersey

questions.question: Which of the following pairs (explorer - region he discovered) is not correct?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cabral - Uruguay

questions.question: Which of the following was not a cause of the Great Geographical Discoveries?

options.text: The Portuguese King thought his admirals would dethrone him and he wanted to send them away.
Many new inventions like the compass helped the sailors a lot.
The Turks controlled the land route to India. That forced the Western countries to seek alternative routes.
Western monarchs along with the Pope wanted to spread their influence through converting the newly discovered nations to Christianity.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Portuguese King thought his admirals would dethrone him and he wanted to send them away.

questions.question: The Great Geographical Discoveries led to the spreading of colonialism and imperialism and even exploitation.
Juneau is the capital of this last frontier state.
Prince Henry the Navigator contributed to the Great Geographical Discoveries by leading all Portuguese expeditions.
Vienna is the capital of this landlocked country, which became a member of the European Union in 1995.
In 1488, a bold captain named Bartholomew Diaz gave the name Cape of Storms to the most southern African tip.  However, the Portuguese King altered the name to this.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cape of Good Hope

questions.question: Phnom Penh is the capital of this country, whose official language is Khmer.
Columbus discovered the Americas in 1492, and is rewarded with this midwestern state naming its capital after him.
How did the political life in England, Spain and France change as a result of the geographical discoveries?

options.text: The political life did not change significantly
They were weakened because their armies were spread thin on other continents
They turned into strong monarchies with rich and autocratic monarchs

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: They turned into strong monarchies with rich and autocratic monarchs

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Capital and State
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, salty, world. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Richmond is the capital of this state where many US presidents were born.
Jefferson City serves as the capital of this Midwestern state.
Austin is the capital of this US state which once existed as an independent republic.
Carson City is the capital of this Battle Born State.

If you are in Sacramento, the capital of this western state, you are within a days drive to beautiful beaches, high mountains with famous national parks, and one of the deepest, most picturesque lakes in the world.
Helena is this Rocky Mountain states capital.
Salt Lake City, known for the salty, barren desert lake to the west of the city, was founded by mormons and is the capital of this geographically diverse state.
Tallahassee is situated on the panhandle of this southern state and serves as its capital.
The capital of this southern state is also known as music city.
This state, which houses one of the largest cities in the world, has Albany as its capital.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: New York

questions.question: This southern state has many beaches, an incredible fort from the revolutionary war, and Columbia as its capital.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: South Carolina

questions.question: This northeast state has Augusta as its capital.
The capital of this diverse northwestern state is Salem.
This midwestern state has Madison as its capital.
This eastern state with rich history has Annapolis as its capital.

quizzes.title: History Quiz: Territory and Seven Wonders
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, people, artemis. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: In what century was the original version of the Seven Wonders of the World list created by Antipater of Sidon?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 2nd century BC

questions.question: The Great Pyramid of Giza, the oldest of the Seven Wonders of the Ancient World, was built approximately how long ago?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 4500 years ago

questions.question: Only this one of the seven wonders of the world survived the trials of time and is open to visitors.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Great Pyramid of Giza

questions.question: This home to 144 million spans 11 time zones and its territory takes up 1/8th of the entire Earth surface.
Dhaka, formerly Dacca, is the capital and largest city of this  country with over 140 million citizens.  Families there are large, unfortunately so is infant mortality.
The Statue of Zeus, a Wonder of the Ancient World created in the ancient city of Olympia in 435 BC, was made primarily of what material?
Like the Great Pyramid of Giza, the Mausoleum of Maussollos is the burial place of an ancient ruler - king Mausollos of Caria. Who conceived the idea of building this ancient wonder of the world?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Maussolloss sister

questions.question: Springfield is the capital of this midwestern state.
Built in honor of the Greek goddess Artemis, the Temple of Artemis was an enormous architectural construction for its time. In Greek mythology, Artemis is the goddes of what?

options.text: Plague, beauty, light, healing, colonists, medicine

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hunt and the moon

questions.question: According to legends, what was the purpose of the most mysterious of the Seven Wonders of the Ancient World -- The Hanging Gardens of Babylon?

options.text: Provide a place of solace and recreation for the rulers

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Comfort a rulers wife

questions.question: There is a vending machine for every 23 of the almost 130 million people that live in this country.
Over 125 million people of more than 250 ethnic groups share the territory of this African country. This constitutes 1/5 of the population of the entire continent.

The Lighthouse of Alexandria, the only one of the Seven Wonders, which had a practical use in addition to architectural elegance, included this remarkable device that astonishes even modern researchers.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A huge mirror

questions.question: A wonder of the ancient world was built on the territory of all of these modern-day countries, but one.  Which is the odd one?
The Colossus of Rhodes was a giant statue, erected at the Greek island Rhodes harbor in 3rd century BC. Which ancient Greek god did the statue depict?

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: City and Country
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, people, pink. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: This is the most populated country in the world - 1.3 billion people live there.  The native language, Mandarin, is most widely spoken, with 885 million speakers.
This East European capital city is famous for its wide, tree-lined boulevards and glorious Belle Epoque buildings. Some call it Little Paris because of these buildings.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bucharest, Romania

questions.question: The name of this 5th largest city in North America originates from a Mohawk word, meaning where there are trees standing in the water.
Constituted of 17,508 islands this country gives home to about 240 million. Its tropical rain forest accounts for 10% of the worlds rain forests.
Islam, Christianity and Hinduism all coexist in this country of 160 million.
This Indian city was the capital of Mogul sovereigns from 1526 to 1658.  Its most notable building is the Taj Mahal.
Indian city again. This one, founded in 1727 AD  is known as The Pink City and is often visited by honeymooners.
The famous Bull Run is held in this Spanish city.
About 75% of the 185 million citizens of this country live in the cities. The largest city is Sao Paulo with a population of 16 million.

In close proximity to this Italian city are the famous ruins of Pompeii, which once was a thriving town for wealthy Romans. The city of Pompeii was destroyed in the cataclysmic eruption of Mount Vesuvius in 79 AD.
The first medical school, Ayurveda was founded in this populous country.
The famous Forbidden City located in this Chinese city.
This American city used to be called  El Pueblo de Nuestra Senora la Reina de (blank) de Porciuncula.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Los Angeles

questions.question: It is home of almost 300 million.  There were millions of buffaloes before the first settlers arrived, but urbanization has been a factor in their decrease.
This city is famous for the fact, that a living goddess dwells there.  She is a young girl by the name of Kumari,  believed to have appeared in the 18th century.

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: State and Country
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, carolina, defeat. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Nicknamed after the international park located in it, this state is often called The Peace Garden State.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: North Dakota

questions.question: This state of the New England region of the United States has the nicknames Pine Tree State and Vacationland.
This state, officially nicknamed The Golden State, is situated in the southern half of the west coast of the USA.
This mid-Atlantic state is called The First State due to the fact that it was the first to ratify the US Constitution.
This Central America country, slightly smaller than South Carolina, withdrew from Colombia in 1903 with the help of US support.
Which Southern state of the United States has a nickname The Magnolia State and a name that is the same as that of a big river?
The name of this city means the capital in the native language.  It is the capital of South Korea.
What is the real name of the Evergreen State, situated in the Pacific Northwest of the United States.
This state, located in the mid-Atlantic region of the USA, has a capital called Trenton and is usually nicknamed The Garden State.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: New Jersey

questions.question: This country, a victor in both World War I and World War II is the largest West European nation.
Due to its natural beauty and relative wilderness, this Southern state is called The Natural State.
In 1895, military defeat forced China to cede this country to Japan. China re-gained control after World War II.
Widely known for huge gambling and the legalization of gambling industry, this states official nickname is The Silver State.
This small Mountain Sate is located in the region of Appalachia in the Eastern parts of the USA.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: West Virginia

questions.question: After multiple agreements between 1772 and 1795, Russia, Prussia, and Austria divided this central European country among themselves.  It finally regained its independence in 1918.

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: A Christmas Story and Film
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, independence, frances. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: In the movie A Christmas Story, when Ralphies mother puts soap in his mouth to teach him a lesson,
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: He goes blind

questions.question: Where do the Parkers end up having Christmas dinner in the film A Christmas Story?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Chinese Restaurant

questions.question: This island country tried to gain its independence from Spain in 1821, but was conquered and ruled by the Haitians for 22 years.  It finally became independent in 1844.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dominican Republic

questions.question: What present does Ralphie want more than anything in the film A Christmas Story?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Red Ryder BB Gun

questions.question: Frances conquest of this country began in 1858 and was completed by 1884.  Independence was declared after World War II, but the French continued to rule until 1954.
This independent country, located in Southeastern Asia was first colonized by Portugal in the 16th century.  Between 1976 and 1999 it was a provice of Indonesia.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: East Timor

questions.question: What does Ralphies dad win in A Christmas Story?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Womans Leg Lamp

questions.question: Who is the little brother of Ralphie, the main character of A Christmas Story?
This Southeast European country allied with the Axis powers and participated in the 1941 German invasion of the USSR.  In 1947, overrun by the Soviets, it bacame a Communist peoples republic.
What favorite television show did the film A Christmas Story inspire?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Wonder Years

questions.question: In A Christmas Story which famous piece of music always played in the background, when the bully and his minion entered a scene?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Peter and the Wolf

questions.question: This kingdom was a founding member of NATO and the EU.  It remained neutral during World War I, but was invaded and occupied by Germany during World War II.
This powerful world empire of the 16th and 17th centuries borders Andorra, France, Gibraltar, Portugal and  Morocco.
Christmas is the Christian holiday that celebrates the birth of Christ.  Christ was born in this city, according to the Bible.
In the movie A Christmas Story, which of Ralphies friends gets his tongue stuck to a pole?
